name: Ruy Lopez
description: One of the oldest and most analyzed openings in chess. White develops the bishop to b5, pinning the knight and preparing to castle.

variations.name: Morphy Defense
variations.description: Black defends the e5 pawn and challenges the bishop.

variations.name: Berlin Defense
variations.description: Black develops the knight to f6, preparing to castle and defend e5.

name: Sicilian Defense
description: Black's most popular response to 1.e4. It creates an asymmetrical position and leads to sharp, tactical play.

variations.name: Najdorf Variation
variations.description: One of the most complex and analyzed variations, favored by many top players.

variations.name: Dragon Variation
variations.description: Black fianchettoes the bishop, creating a sharp, tactical position.

name: French Defense
description: A solid defense that leads to closed positions. Black prepares to challenge the center with d5.

variations.name: Winawer Variation
variations.description: Black pins the knight, creating tactical opportunities.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: Black develops the knight to f6, maintaining flexibility.

name: King's Indian Defense
description: A hypermodern opening where Black allows White to control the center with pawns, then attacks it.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: White establishes a strong center, Black prepares kingside attack.

variations.name: Four Pawns Attack
variations.description: White creates a massive center, Black must counterattack.

name: Queen's Gambit
description: White offers a pawn to gain control of the center. One of the most popular openings in chess.

variations.name: Queen's Gambit Accepted
variations.description: Black accepts the gambit, leading to open play.

variations.name: Queen's Gambit Declined
variations.description: Black declines the gambit, maintaining solid position.

name: Italian Game
description: A classic opening that develops the bishop to c4, attacking the f7 square.

variations.name: Giuoco Piano
variations.description: Both sides develop bishops to active squares.

variations.name: Evans Gambit
variations.description: White sacrifices a pawn for rapid development and attack.

name: Caro-Kann Defense
description: A solid defense that supports the d5 advance. Black avoids the complications of the Sicilian while maintaining good chances.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: Black recaptures with the c-pawn, maintaining solid structure.

variations.name: Panov-Botvinnik Attack
variations.description: White creates an IQP position with attacking chances.

name: Pirc Defense
description: A hypermodern defense where Black allows White to control the center, then attacks it with pieces.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: Both sides develop naturally, Black prepares kingside attack.

variations.name: Austrian Attack
variations.description: White creates a strong center and kingside attack.

name: Scandinavian Defense
description: Black immediately challenges the e4 pawn. A direct approach that can lead to sharp play.

variations.name: Main Line
variations.description: Black recaptures with the queen, developing early.

variations.name: Modern Variation
variations.description: Black develops the knight, maintaining flexibility.

name: English Opening
description: A flexible opening that can transpose into many other openings. White controls d5 and prepares for various setups.

variations.name: Symmetrical Variation
variations.description: Black mirrors White's move, creating symmetrical position.

variations.name: Reversed Sicilian
variations.description: Black plays e5, creating a reversed Sicilian structure.

name: Dutch Defense
description: Black immediately challenges White's center control with f5, preparing for kingside attack.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: Black develops naturally, preparing kingside attack.

variations.name: Stonewall Variation
variations.description: Black creates a solid pawn structure with attacking chances.

name: Grünfeld Defense
description: A hypermodern defense where Black allows White to control the center, then attacks it.

variations.name: Exchange Variation
variations.description: White exchanges pawns, creating an IQP position.

variations.name: Russian System
variations.description: Black maintains the knight on d5 for pressure.

name: Nimzo-Indian Defense
description: Black pins the knight and prepares to double White's c-pawns, creating long-term pressure.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: White protects the knight, avoiding doubled pawns.

variations.name: Sämisch Variation
variations.description: White accepts doubled pawns for attacking chances.

name: Queen's Indian Defense
description: Black prepares to fianchetto the bishop, creating a solid and flexible position.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: Both sides fianchetto bishops, creating a strategic battle.

variations.name: Petrosian Variation
variations.description: White prevents the bishop pin and prepares queenside expansion.

name: Catalan Opening
description: White combines queenside expansion with kingside fianchetto, creating a harmonious setup.

variations.name: Open Catalan
variations.description: Black recaptures with the knight, maintaining flexibility.

variations.name: Closed Catalan
variations.description: White maintains the tension in the center.

name: Trompowsky Attack
description: White immediately pins the knight, avoiding main line theory and creating unique positions.

variations.name: Classical Defense
variations.description: Black develops naturally, preparing to castle.

variations.name: Pseudo-Trompowsky
variations.description: Black challenges the bishop immediately.

name: Slav Defense
description: A solid defense that maintains the d5 pawn. Black avoids the isolated queen's pawn that can arise in the Queen's Gambit Declined.

variations.name: Semi-Slav
variations.description: Black combines c6 and e6, creating a flexible structure.

variations.name: Slav Accepted
variations.description: Black recaptures with the c-pawn, maintaining solid structure.

name: Semi-Slav Defense
description: A flexible defense that combines the solidity of the Slav with the dynamic possibilities of the Queen's Gambit Declined.

variations.name: Meran Variation
variations.description: Black accepts the gambit, leading to sharp tactical play.

variations.name: Anti-Meran
variations.description: White exchanges pawns, avoiding the Meran complications.

name: King's Indian Attack
description: White adopts a hypermodern setup with kingside fianchetto, preparing for kingside attack.

variations.name: Classical Defense
variations.description: Black develops naturally, preparing queenside expansion.

variations.name: Symmetrical Defense
variations.description: Black mirrors White's setup, creating symmetrical position.

name: Larsen Opening
description: A hypermodern opening that prepares queenside fianchetto, avoiding main line theory.

variations.name: Classical Defense
variations.description: Black develops naturally, preparing kingside attack.

variations.name: Symmetrical Defense
variations.description: Black mirrors White's setup, creating symmetrical position.

name: Bird Opening
description: White immediately attacks the kingside, preparing for aggressive play and potential kingside attack.

variations.name: From Gambit
variations.description: Black sacrifices a pawn for rapid development and attacking chances.

variations.name: Classical Defense
variations.description: Black develops naturally, preparing queenside expansion.

name: Scotch Game
description: White immediately challenges the center with d4, leading to open positions and tactical play.

variations.name: Scotch Gambit
variations.description: White sacrifices a pawn for rapid development and attack.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: White recaptures with the knight, maintaining control.

name: Petroff Defense
description: Black immediately challenges the knight, leading to symmetrical positions and solid play.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: Black recaptures the pawn, maintaining symmetry.

variations.name: Steinitz Variation
variations.description: White challenges the center immediately.

name: Philidor Defense
description: A solid but passive defense where Black supports the e5 pawn and prepares for kingside development.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: Black develops the knight, maintaining flexibility.

variations.name: Hanham Variation
variations.description: Black develops the knight to d7, preparing kingside attack.

name: Vienna Game
description: White develops the knight early, preparing for kingside attack and avoiding main line theory.

variations.name: Classical Variation
variations.description: White creates a kingside attack with f4.

variations.name: Falkbeer Variation
variations.description: White develops naturally, maintaining flexibility.

name: Bishop's Opening
description: White develops the bishop to c4, attacking the f7 square and preparing for kingside attack.

variations.name: Classical Defense
variations.description: Black develops the knight, defending f7 and preparing kingside attack.

variations.name: Urusov Gambit
variations.description: White sacrifices a pawn for rapid development and attack.

name: King's Gambit
description: A romantic gambit where White sacrifices a pawn for rapid development and kingside attack.

variations.name: King's Gambit Accepted
variations.description: Black accepts the gambit, leading to sharp tactical play.

variations.name: Falkbeer Countergambit
variations.description: Black counterattacks in the center, sacrificing a pawn.

name: Benko Gambit
description: Black sacrifices a pawn for queenside pressure and long-term positional compensation.

variations.name: Accepted Variation
variations.description: White accepts the gambit, leading to queenside pressure.

variations.name: Declined Variation
variations.description: White maintains the extra pawn but faces queenside pressure.
